question:
You are developing several tag libraries that will be sold for development of third-party web
applications. You are about to publish the first three libraries as JAR files: container-tags.jar,
advanced-html-form-tags.jar, and basic-html-form-tags.jar. Which two techniques are appropriate for packaging the TLD files for these tag libraries? (Choose two.)

options.A: The TLD must be located within the WEB-INF directory of the JAR file.
options.B: The TLD must be located within the META-INF directory of the JAR file.
options.C: The TLD must be located within the META-INF/tld/ directory of the JAR file.
options.D: The TLD must be located within a subdirectory of WEB-INF directory of the JAR file.
options.E: The TLD must be located within a subdirectory of META-INF directory of the JAR file.
options.F: The TLD must be located within a subdirectory of META-INF/tld/ directory of the JAR file.
